SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.manager

Class ActorManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.manager.ActorManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActorSpawner
public class ActorManager extends Object implements ActorSpawner
The ActorManager class is responsible for managing and updating all active actors in the game. It follows the singleton pattern to ensure only one instance of the manager exists. The manager handles adding, removing, and updating actors, as well as managing UI elements.
See Also:

    • removeActor

      public void removeActor(ActiveActor actor)
      Removes the specified actor from the list of active actors and from the UI. This method ensures that the removal is performed on the JavaFX Application Thread.
      Parameters:
      actor - the ActiveActor to be removed

    • updateAllActors

      public void updateAllActors(long now)
      Updates all active actors with the current time.

      This method creates a copy of the list of actors to avoid Each actor's update method is called with the provided timestamp.

      Parameters:
      now - the current time in milliseconds

    • removeDestroyedActors

      public void removeDestroyedActors()
      Removes all destroyed actors from the list of actors and from the root's children. An actor is considered destroyed if its `isDestroyed` method returns true. This method iterates through the list of actors and removes each actor that is destroyed.

    • cleanup

      public void cleanup()
      Cleans up the active actors by destroying each actor, removing it from the root's children, and then removing it from the list of actors. This method iterates over a copy of the actors list to avoid ConcurrentModificationException during the removal process.

    • getPlayers

      public List<UserPlane> getPlayers()
      Retrieves a list of all actors that are instances of UserPlane.
      Specified by:
      getPlayers in interface ActorSpawner
      Returns:
      a list of UserPlane objects representing the players.

    • getUserProjectiles

      public List<ActiveActor> getUserProjectiles()
      Retrieves a list of user projectiles from the collection of actors.
      Returns:
      a list of ActiveActor objects that are instances of UserProjectile.

    • getEnemyUnits

      public List<ActiveActor> getEnemyUnits()
      Retrieves a list of enemy units from the collection of actors. An enemy unit is defined as an instance of FighterPlane that is not an instance of UserPlane.
      Specified by:
      getEnemyUnits in interface ActorSpawner
      Returns:
      a list of ActiveActor objects representing enemy units.

    • getEnemyProjectiles

      public List<ActiveActor> getEnemyProjectiles()

      Returns:
      a list of ActiveActor objects that are instances of EnemyProjectile.
